intro: Paratropia singalangensis, commonly known as the Singalang endemic, is a rare plant species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are generally elliptical with a smooth surface and dark green coloration. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
